DOC.brief_title: Effects Airway Lumen Talsaclidine Combination With Propranolol Comparison Effects Monosubstances Healthy Elderly Male Volunteers
DOC.criteria: All participant study healthy male , range 50 65 year age within + 20 % normal weight ( BrocaIndex ) . Volunteers exclude study result medical examination laboratory test ( especially indicate liver malfunction ) judge clinical investigator differ significantly normal clinical value Volunteers blood pressure low 120/80 mm Hg pulse rate 60 beats/min Volunteers whose blood pressure drop 100/60 mm Hg pretest within 80 mg propranolol Volunteers Rawvalues higher predict normal upper limit Volunteers know gastrointestinal , hepatic , renal , respiratory , cardiovascular , metabolic , immunological hormonal disorder Volunteers disease central nervous system ( epilepsy ) psychiatric disorder Volunteers know history orthostatic hypotension , faint spell blackouts Volunteers chronic relevant acute infection Volunteers history allergy / hypersensitivity ( include drug allergy ) deem relevant trial judge investigator Volunteers take drug long half life ( > =24 hour ) within least one month le ten half life respective drug enrolment study Volunteers receive drug might influence result trial week prior start study Volunteers participate another study investigational drug within last 2 month precede study Volunteers unable refrain smoking study day Volunteers smoke 10 cigarette ( 3 cigar pipe ) per day Volunteers drink 40 g alcohol per day Volunteers dependent drug Volunteers donate blood ( > =100ml ) within last 4 week Volunteers participate excessive physical activity ( e.g . competitive sport ) within last week study
